title: Yiannis Pathiakakis Stadium
text: Yannis Pathiakakis Stadium is a <a href="multi-purpose%20stadium">multi-purpose stadium</a> in <a href="Ano%20Liosia">Ano Liosia</a>, <a href="Greece">Greece</a>. It is currently used mostly for <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> matches and is the home stadium of <a href="Akratitos">Akratitos</a>. The stadium holds 5,000 and was built in 1965. It is named after <a href="Giannis%20Pathiakakis">Giannis Pathiakakis</a>, who guided Akratitos from the lower ranks to the top flight but died in 2002 on the pitch during a training session.
